alert.note: Alert for Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 2:11AM PST until January 14 at 1:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow. Snow accumulations less than an inch except locally higher amounts up to 3 inches along Interstate 80 between Lovelock and Winnemucca, and Highway 50 east of Fallon. Snow accumulations 3 to 6 inches along the higher elevations of the Humboldt and Stillwater Ranges and the Desatoya Mountains. Southwest winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 40 mph. Wave heights on Pyramid Lake 2 to 5 feet. * WHERE...Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake. * WHEN...Until 1 AM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Roads may become slick and blowing snow may cause lower visibility while driving. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Small boats, kayaks and paddle boards will be prone to capsizing and should remain off Pyramid Lake until conditions improve.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Check lake conditions on Pyramid Lake before heading out and be prepared for a sudden increase in winds and wave heights. Consider postponing boating activities on the lake until a day with less wind.

area.areaDesc: Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake
